net.hudup.core.alg

Class Recommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.alg.AbstractAlg
      • net.hudup.core.alg.Recommender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Alg
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompositeRecommender, MemoryBasedRecommender, ModelBasedRecommender, ServiceRecommender

    public abstract class Recommender
extends AbstractAlg
    This abstract class represents all recommendation algorithms. Its two typical inherited classes are MemoryBasedRecomender and ModelBasedRecommender which in turn are abstract classes for memory-based recommendation algorithm and model-based recommendation algorithm. All completed recommendation algorithms must inherit directly this Recommender or derived indirectly from MemoryBasedRecomender class and ModelBasedRecommender class. These completed recommendation algorithms must implement two main abstract methods estimate(RecommendParam, Set) and recommend(RecommendParam, int) and two other abstract methods such as setup(Dataset, Object...) and getDataset(). As a convention, this class and all classes extending it are called recommender.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • filterList

        protected RecommendFilterList filterList
        The filter list contains of filters. Filter specifies tasks which be performed before any actual recommendation tasks. Concretely, two methods estimate(RecommendParam, Set) and recommend(RecommendParam, int) require filtering tasks specified by filters of this list. Suppose every item has types 1, 2, 3, an example of filtering task is to select only type-1 items for recommendation task, which means that the list of recommended items produced by the method recommend(RecommendParam, int) later contains only type-1 items.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Recommender

        public Recommender()
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public abstract void setup(Dataset dataset,
                           java.lang.Object... params)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Setting up this recommender based on specified dataset and additional parameters
        Parameters:
        dataset - dataset is the main parameter to setup this recommender.
        params - Additional parameters to set up this recommender. This parameter is really an array of sub-parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any error occurs.

      • unsetup

        public void unsetup()
        Unset this recommender. After this method is called, this recommender cannot be used unless the method setup(Dataset, Object...) is called again.

      • getFilterList

        public RecommendFilterList getFilterList()
        Getting a list of filters. Filter specifies tasks which be performed before any actual recommendation tasks. Two methods estimate(RecommendParam, Set) and recommend(RecommendParam, int) will call this method before estimation task and recommendation task. Suppose every item have types 1, 2, 3, an example of filtering task is to select only type-1 items for recommendation task, which means that the list of recommended items produced by the method recommend(RecommendParam, int) later contains only type-1 items.
        Returns:
        list of filters.

      • getDataset

        public abstract Dataset getDataset()
        Any recommender has always a reference to a dataset represented by Dataset class because recommender is executed on the dataset. Some recommender (s) store internal dataset but others only have references to dataset. Anyway, such reference always exists.
        Returns:
        reference to dataset.

      • estimate

        public abstract RatingVector estimate(RecommendParam param,
                                      java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> queryIds)
        This method is very important, which is used to estimate rating values of given items (users). Any class that extends this abstract class must implement this method. Note that the role of user and the role of item are exchangeable. Rating vector can be user rating vector or item rating vector. Please see RatingVector for more details. The input parameters are a recommendation parameter and a set of item (user) identifiers. The output result is a set of predictive or estimated rating values of items (users) specified by the second input parameter.
        Parameters:
        param - recommendation parameter. Please see RecommendParam for more details of this parameter.
        queryIds - set of identifications (IDs) of items that need to be estimated their rating values.
        Returns:
        rating vector contains estimated rating values of the specified set of IDs of items (users).

      • recommend

        public abstract RatingVector recommend(RecommendParam param,
                                       int maxRecommend)
        This method is the most important one in recommendation task. Any class that extends this abstract class must implement this method. Note that the role of user and the role of item are exchangeable. Rating vector can be user rating vector or item rating vector. Please see RatingVector for more details. The input parameters are a recommendation parameter and the maximum recommended items (users) in the returned rating vector. The output result is a list of recommended items (users) which is provided to the user (item).
        Parameters:
        param - recommendation parameter. Please see RecommendParam for more details of this parameter.
        maxRecommend - the maximum recommended items (users) in the returned rating vector.
        Returns:
        list of recommended items (users) which is provided to the user (item), represented by RatingVector class. The number of items (users) of such list is specified by the the maximum number.

      • preprocess

        protected RecommendParam preprocess(RecommendParam param)
        Pre-processing the specified recommendation parameter. For example, if this recommendation parameter only has user identifier (user ID) but it has no ratings then, this method fills in ratings by reading such ratings from framework database.
        Parameters:
        param - recommendation parameter. Please see RecommendParam for more details of this parameter.
        Returns:
        new recommendation parameter that is processed from the specified recommendation parameter.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
